DataElement.preferredName: Healthcare Facility Pathologist Determine Diagnostic Oncology Disease World Health Organization Histology Classification
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The World Health Organization histology classification determined by a healthcare facility pathologist.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Healthcare Facility Pathologist Determine Diagnostic Oncology Disease or Disorder World Health Organization Histology Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided._Any physician whose career is devoted to the study of pathology._The establishment of a state or result._Characteristic or indicative of a condition._The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.:Any physician whose career is devoted to the study of pathology.:The establishment of a state or result.:Characteristic or indicative of a condition.:The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.
Any physician whose career is devoted to the study of pathology.
The establishment of a state or result.
Characteristic or indicative of a condition.
The study of tumors encompassing the physical, chemical, and biologic properties.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services.:The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.:A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

Concepts.definition: A United Nations agency established to coordinate international health activities and to help governments improve health services.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).
